Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
@Kenyre 
check what block you are in. use getinfo
once you found the block number, e.g: for block 1444008 use getblockhash 1444008
once you have the hash for the block you are stuck at, use invalidateblock <BLOCKHASH> without <> like the command below
once that is done, use reconsiderblock 035ee329fe10944f1b0bf659a8b8d2424322b98532deba0fe225f26eb350fdb2

Author: Kenyre#1734
Content: Thanks for the quick reply! I'll try it right away

Author: knijia#0971
Content: Hi, i made an invalid claim last saturday. After verifications, i remembered that i created a new address from the recommendations here https://support.komodoplatform.com/support/solutions/articles/29000029932-agama-security-announcement right after i read an article about the problem. I installed Agama-Windows-v0.6.0-13-PBaaS-Cross-chain-Technology-Preview, created a new seed, PIN and password, i then moved 159 KMD to the new address (RRFgArgcHaBFwKqYFdh1hifuUvGjCQPBJo). I'm sure i did it right, but now when i enter the seed, the address it gaves me is RErMuJnN3Ccphj5366tyPPHR4x7XXnoJg2 and i can't find the 159 KMD i had (it seems to be on the RRFgArgcHaBFwKqYFdh1hifuUvGjCQPBJo on which it seems i have no control over it) . I'm a bit lost, does someone has any idea of what is happening to me ? Thanks.

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
@knijia
input the seed without extra spaces.
 https://support.komodoplatform.com/support/solutions/articles/29000027661-why-am-i-not-seeing-the-same-address-when-i-login-

if you had given the wallet a name and setup a password, you can use the password to login

Author: knijia#0971
Content: @gcharang Thanks for your answer. It's accurate that if i had an extra space, it gaves me another address, but it's seems not to be the address it was first given to me (the address i sent 159 KMD : RRFgArgcHaBFwKqYFdh1hifuUvGjCQPBJo) and it's empty. When creating my new address on june 6th, i indeed fill in a custom pin filename and a password i set up. When logging with these credentials, the KMD address is RErMuJnN3Ccphj5366tyPPHR4x7XXnoJg2 which is not the one it was first given to me.

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: @knijia  when you are logging in using walletname + password, you did leave the "wallet seed/wif" field empty, correct?

Author: knijia#0971
Content: @gcharang yes, only custom PIN (already displayed) and the password.

Author: knijia#0971
Content: what is sure is that i then sent my KMD to that address created in lite mode (address that was given to me with custom pin, password and seed) but it's not the address it gaves me now. I really don't understand how it's possible.

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
@knijia I am not sure what else could be wrong 

may be try adding extra spaces either before the first word or after the last word
or in both places

and see if the other address is created

Author: knijia#0971
Content: @gcharang yes i must admit that i don't understand where i made a mistake, i followed the steps with attention and checked if the transfer of the 159KMD arrived and i saw in the wallet that the KMD had arrived and then i closed everything reassured. It's only a few days ago when i reopened it that i saw it empty. That's why i first thought of the sweep.

Author: knijia#0971
Content: i tried everything possible but i guess it's lost forever. It's weird to see the coins and not being able to access it üò™
